title: Before & after: Satellite images show damage to terror camps in Pak after Op Sindoor
content: Following the deadly Phalgam terror attack, the Indian Army launched 'Operation Sindoor,' conducting precision strikes on nine terror camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Satellite images reveal substantial damage to key locations, including the Jamia Mosque in Bahawalpur and a LeT training center in Muridke. The operation targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen bases, carefully avoiding Pakistani military installations.

title: 5 dead as helicopter crashes in Uttarkashi's Gangnani area
content: A helicopter carrying Char Dham pilgrims crashed near Gangnani in Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand, resulting in six fatalities, including the pilot, Captain Robin Singh. One injured passenger was airlifted to AIIMS Rishikesh. The Aero Trans Service Pvt Ltd helicopter, en route from Dehradun to Kharsali near Yamunotri, crashed 200-250 meters down a gorge.

title: 'Sabko young captain chahiye ... ': Rohit Sharma opens up
content: Rohit Sharma has announced his retirement from Test cricket, ending speculation about his future in the format. The 38-year-old will continue to lead India in ODIs, having already retired from T20Is. Sharma scored 4,301 runs in 67 Tests, with 12 centuries. In a recent interview with journalist Vimal Kumar, Rohit opened up about his journey and the doubts he once had about leading India.

title: The many laurels of Col. Sofiya Qureshi: 15 things you need to know about her
content: Vadodara celebrated Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, a third-generation Army officer, for her address on Operation Sindoor. She served as a military observer in Congo, contributing to peacekeeping efforts and earning commendations. Colonel Qureshi led an Indian Army contingent at Force 18 and motivated thousands of students, receiving numerous awards and recognition for her service and dedication.

title: Microsoft HR now 'bans' employees who are ...
content: Microsoft is implementing a two-year rehire ban for underperforming employees and tracking "good attrition," signaling a stricter management approach. This policy shift, revealed in internal documents, mirrors similar practices at other tech giants like Amazon and Meta. The company is also offering struggling employees a separation package as an alternative to performance improvement plans.

title: Watch: After 'Operation Sindoor', Eden echoes with patriotic fervour
content: Eden Gardens witnessed a powerful display of patriotism during the KKR-CSK IPL clash, with a moving rendition of "Maa Tujhe Salaam" honoring India's defence forces after "Operation Sindoor". However, KKR's batting faltered after a strong start, as CSK's Noor Ahmad's 4/31 restricted them to 179/6, overshadowing the pre-match patriotic fervor despite Russell's effort.

title: Watch: Jaisalmer’s Sonar Fort goes dark in security drill
content: Following India's strikes on terror launchpads, Sonar Fort in Jaisalmer went dark during a security drill, and Rajasthan's border districts were placed on high alert. Schools were indefinitely closed, and civilian flight operations were suspended at several airports, including Jodhpur and Jaisalmer. Air defence systems were activated, and residents reported increased military activity, reflecting heightened tensions.

title: Bomb threat hits KKR vs CSK IPL match at Eden Gardens
content: A bomb threat disrupted the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) and Chennai Super Kings (CSK) IPL match at Eden Gardens, prompting a police investigation and heightened security. The threat arrived via email amidst national security concerns following the Pahalgam attack, coinciding with India's 'Operation Sindoor' against terror targets. Chennai Super Kings edged out KKR by two wickets in a nail-biting finish, virtually knocking the defending champions out of IPL playoff contention.

title: Elon Musk warns 'All life on Earth will be destroyed by...'
content: Elon Musk, SpaceX founder, warns of the sun's eventual destruction of Earth, advocating for Mars colonization as humanity's long-term survival strategy. He emphasizes the urgency of establishing a self-sustaining civilization on Mars, viewing it as "life insurance" for humanity. SpaceX is actively developing plans for Martian habitats and addressing the challenges of establishing a permanent colony.

title: What's the gold rate outlook for May 8 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: MCX Gold exhibits a strong bullish trend, poised to retest its all-time high near ₹99,700, supported by global uncertainties and central bank demand. MCX Silver demonstrates resilience, bouncing from a key Fibonacci retracement level, and is likely to surpass its previous swing high of 98,800, potentially reaching 1,00,000.

title: France President says US is committing error by withdrawing researchers’ visas
content: European leaders are actively courting American researchers with substantial financial incentives, viewing U.S. cuts to research funding as a critical mistake. France and the European Commission have pledged significant investments, totaling hundreds of millions of dollars, to attract talent and bolster their own research programs.

title: 3 Greyhounds commandos killed in landmine blast triggered by Maoists in Telangana
content: In a tragic incident, three junior commandos from the Telangana's Greyhounds anti-Naxal force were killed in a Maoist-triggered landmine blast along the Telangana-Chhattisgarh border. The explosion occurred during a routine area domination exercise in the Mulugu district. This marks the first fatalities for Telangana Police in anti-Maoist operations this year.

title: Watch: Blackout at Amritsar's Golden Temple as lights switched off for mock drill
content: A nationwide civil defence drill, ordered by the Ministry of Home Affairs, included a blackout in Amritsar to assess emergency preparedness. The exercise, part of Operation Sindoor following a terrorist attack, involved switching off lights at key locations, including the Golden Temple, between 10:30 pm and 11 pm. Similar blackouts were observed in other states and cities across India.

title: MS Dhoni’s CSK end 6-year wait to break unwanted record
content: Already out of the playoff race, Chennai Super Kings played party-poopers as they pulled off a thrilling two-wicket win over Kolkata Knight Riders, effectively knocking the defending champions out of contention on Wednesday. Chasing 180, CSK crossed the finish line with two balls to spare. Dewald Brevis set the tone with a blistering 52 off just 25 balls, while Shivam Dube chipped in with a crucial 45. Skipper MS Dhoni remained unbeaten on 17, steering his side to victory in a tense finish.

title: 'Great player for India but ... ': Ganguly on Rohit's Test retirement
content: Sourav Ganguly lauded Rohit Sharma, following Sharma's Test retirement announcement on Wednesday. Ganguly highlighted Sharma's significant contributions to India's trophy wins and leadership. Sharma, aged 38, played 67 Tests, amassing 4,301 runs with 12 centuries. Despite home dominance, he faced overseas challenges, though he shone in the 2021-22 Pataudi Trophy in England, marking a high point in his Test career.

title: Helicopter with seven on board crashes in Uttarkashi district
content: One person has been rescued, but there is no clarity yet about the fate of others, Uttarkashi District Disaster Management Officer Shardul Singh said

title: Vision plans for all Assembly constituencies will be ready by next month, says A.P. CM
content: Thematic reports will be ready by June, and sectoral roadmaps by September, say officials; plans are afoot to introduce a dedicated Population Management Policy

title: Schools shut across border districts in Punjab and Rajasthan following 'Operation Sindoor'
content: All government and private schools in the border districts of Rajasthan including Barmer, Bikaner, Sri Ganganagar and Jaisalmer have declared a holiday until further notification.

title: Symbol row: focus on local body polls, SC tells Shiv Sena (UBT)
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and N. Kotiswar Singh told senior advocate Kapil Sibal, appearing for Shiv Sena (UBT), the matter could be taken up only after the court’s summer break due to the paucity of time.

title: AgustaWestland case: Delhi HC reserves order on Christian Michel’s plea to relax bail conditions
content: Mr. James, a British national currently lodged in Tihar Jail, appeared before the court via videoconferencing. He requested a relaxation of two key bail conditions: furnishing a ₹5 lakh surety and surrendering his passport.

title: More than a ride: Book captures the soul of Bengaluru’s bus commutes
content: Compiled by a team of writers and volunteers, the book showcases vignettes of connection and community experienced aboard the city’s public buses

title: Pakistan’s complex web of terror networks
content: Pakistan’s terror infrastructure has survived for decades within its security establishment, which views these forces as strategic assets. Pakistan has been placed on and off the Financial Action Task Force ‘grey list’ since 2008 for failing to dismantle terror financing networks

title: Kin of Pahalgam terror attacks hail the retaliatory strikes
content: Family members of the Pahalgam terror attack victims expressed gratitude to the forces for the “swift and fitting response”.

title: Orthopaedic surgeon Soundarapandian passes away at 94
content: Dr. Soundarapandian was born in Thoothukudi on July 4, 1931, and completed his MBBS degree from the Stanley Medical College and MS General Surgery and MS Orthopeadics from the Madras Medical College (MMC).

title: Mock drills conducted, border areas in Rajasthan on high alert
content: Acting on the Union Home Ministry’s directives, the mock drills were carried out in as many as 28 cities across the State

title: Mock drill held in eleven districts of Bihar and Jharkhand
content: As drills were conducted against the backdrop of Operation Sindoor, political leaders in Bihar and Jharkhand cut across the party lines, and praised the actions of the Army.

title: Operation Sindoor LIVE: 21 airports in northern parts of India shut until May 10
content: Shelling by Pakistani troops in J&K’s Kupwara, Baramulla, Uri and Akhnoor areas; at least 12 civilians and one soldier killed, many injured

title: Operation Sindoor: Alia Bhatt hails armed forces' retaliatory strike on Pakistan
content: Following the retaliatory Operation Sindoor, launched after the tragic Pahalgam attack, Alia Bhatt voiced her support for the Indian Armed Forces. The operation targeted terror infrastructure across Pakistan and PoK, responding to the April 22 attack that killed 26 civilians. Bhatt's upcoming projects include 'Alpha' and 'Love and War'.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex up over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green on Thursday a day after Operation Sindoor. While Nifty50 was above 24,400, BSE Sensex crossed 80,800.

title: Who will replace Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain?
content: Following Rohit Sharma's Test retirement, Madan Lal has proposed Jasprit Bumrah for India's Test captaincy, citing his consistent performance and permanent team status. Bumrah's previous captaincy stint includes a win against Australia and a loss against England. Rohit Sharma's retirement marks the end of a career that included 67 Tests, 4,301 runs, and 12 centuries.

title: The 80/20 rule for weight loss: How people are shedding pounds without dieting
content: Tired of restrictive diets? The 80/20 rule offers a balanced approach to eating, allowing you to enjoy your favorite foods without guilt. By focusing on wholesome foods 80% of the time and indulging the other 20%, you can avoid cravings and maintain healthy habits. Celebrities like Drew Barrymore swear by it. However, moderation and mindful choices are key to success.

title: Operation Sindoor: India on high alert on land, air and sea
content: In anticipation of potential retaliation from Pakistan, India has fortified its defense systems across land, air, and sea. The air defense network is activated, warships are deployed, and frontline units are prepared. Strategic Forces Command is on high alert, with new weapon systems integrated since Balakot, enhancing India's readiness to respond to any misadventure.

title: This Bollywood actor wore the army uniform for real and fought the Kargil War
content: Nana Patekar, the acclaimed Bollywood actor and three-time national award winner, served in the Indian Army during the 1999 Kargil War. Despite initial resistance, he secured permission to join the forces after contacting the Defence Minister, George Fernandes. Patekar spent over two weeks assisting soldiers near the LoC and volunteering at a base hospital, experiencing a profound sense of fulfillment.

title: Check direct link to download Gujarat Board SSC scorecards here
content: The Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board has announced the GSEB Class 10 Result 2025 on May 8. Students can access their scores on the official website, gseb.org, or via WhatsApp by sending their seat number to 6357300971. Further details on mark verification, supplementary exams, and document submission will be released online soon.

title: Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli step out for dinner after Avneet Kaur controversy
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli have finally made a public appearance together amidst the growing buzz online regarding the cricketer’s recent ‘like’ on actress Avneet Kaur’s photoshoot, followed by his clarification blaming the algorithm. The matter took an unexpected turn when singer Rahul Vaidya took a dig at him for blaming the algorithm and for previously blocking him.

title: IPL playoff scenarios: Odds explained for each team
content: With 13 matches remaining, CSK, RR, and SRH are out of playoff contention. GT, RCB, and PBKS are almost certain to qualify, while MI and DC have a decent chance. LSG and KKR face slim odds, but with 8,192 possible outcomes, nothing is guaranteed. GT has a 99.3% chance of finishing in the top four and a 74.

title: Trump to announce 'major trade deal' with a ‘big and highly respected’ nation
content: President Trump is set to unveil a major trade deal tomorrow, amid ongoing trade tensions, particularly with China, and the start of US-China talks in Switzerland. The announcement follows recent US tariff impositions on Chinese imports, which Trump defends as necessary to correct trade imbalances. The market has reacted cautiously, and the Federal Reserve warns of potential economic reshaping.

title: Operation Sindoor: Strikes steel PM Modi's iron man credentials
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Prime Minister Modi authorized Operation Sindoor, defying international calls for restraint and skepticism about India's response. The precision strikes, showcasing advanced weaponry, countered Pakistan's nuclear threats and reaffirmed Modi's strong stance on national security. This decisive action silenced critics and bolstered public confidence, signaling a higher risk appetite for future security challenges and reinforcing the BJP's dominance in security matters.

title: This one drink before 11pm could boost muscle growth while you sleep
content: Dr. Mark Hyman highlighted a study indicating that consuming 40 grams of casein protein 30 minutes before bed enhances muscle repair and growth during sleep. Casein, a slow-digesting protein found in dairy, provides a sustained release of amino acids, crucial for overnight muscle recovery. Incorporating casein through shakes or natural sources like cottage cheese can optimize muscle protein synthesis.

title: Husbands killed by terrorists, justice delivered by Operation Sindoor
content: Families of victims killed in a recent terrorist attack express solace and gratitude following India's retaliatory airstrikes, dubbed 'Operation Sindoor.' They believe justice has been served and that the action brings peace to the souls of their loved ones. Many implore the government to continue its offensive against terrorists to ensure the safety and security of the nation and prevent future tragedies.

title: Message to world: Strikes were in line with UNSC call to punish terrorists
content: India conducted military strikes, Operation Sindoor, targeting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan, citing the Pahalgam attack as a catalyst. Foreign Secretary Misri emphasized the strikes were non-escalatory and proportionate, linking the TRF to Lashkar-e-Taiba and Pakistan. India aims to deter further cross-border attacks and dismantle terror networks, highlighting Pakistan's failure to act against its own terrorist infrastructure and its history of misleading the international community on terrorism.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today
content: HSBC downgraded Avenue Supermarts citing margin pressures, while Macquarie maintained an outperform rating on HPCL after strong quarterly earnings. Morgan Stanley remains overweight on KEI Industries, highlighting robust cable and wire revenue growth. Jefferies reiterated a buy rating for Polycab, noting market share gains and strong sales.

title: Diddy trial: Judge scolds lawyer for calling prosecutors 'pack of white women'
content: In Sean "Diddy" Combs' sex trafficking trial, a federal judge cautioned his lawyer, Mark Geragos, about public comments, deeming his description of prosecutors as a "six-pack of white women" outrageous. Jury selection is ongoing, with opening statements set for Monday. Combs, who has pleaded not guilty to racketeering and sex trafficking charges, remains jailed.

title: PM Modi to Cabinet: Moment of pride, a unique op, it's only the beginning
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi commended the security forces on Wednesday for their successful strikes against terror facilities in Pakistan and POK, stating the nation is "proud" of their efforts. Sources indicate Modi emphasized the operation's necessity and the importance of continued preparedness for future security challenges.

title: 15 lakh people across nation join hands to test & enforce safety measures
content: A nationwide civil defence drill, initiated by the home ministry, saw widespread participation exceeding initial expectations, encompassing nearly 350 districts and 1.5 million individuals. The exercise aimed to test and reinforce safety protocols like blackouts and evacuations, revealing both successful enforcement and identified gaps in the existing civil defence infrastructure, particularly regarding outdated equipment and coordination in key areas like Delhi airport.

title: Mock drills conducted in 5 M.P. districts; BJP, Congress praise Armed Forces
content: Drills, reviewed by CM Mohan Yadav, followed ‘Operation Sindoor’ retaliatory strikes against sites in Pakistan and PoK; State leaders united in support of military action.

title: Pahalgam victims’ in Bengal feel a weight lift after Operation Sindoor attacks
content: The wife of a BSF trooper, Purnam Kumar Sahu, being held by Pakistani forces had contrasting sentiments on the operation as she awaited news of her husband

title: Security tightened in Punjab; Himachal reviews security and communication systems
content: Many pilgrims arrived at the Kartarpur corridor on May 7 morning to offer prayers at the gurdwara in Pakistan but were asked to return

title: Shelling by Pakistani troops in J&K's Kupwara, Baramulla, Uri and Akhnoor areas
content: The Pakistani side targeted civilian areas in the Karnah area, firing shells and mortars after midnight, officials said

title: Blackout drill resumes in Amritsar, residents asked to remain indoors
content: Taking utmost caution, the Amritsar district administration has again started the blackout drill, said a message shared by the Amritsar District Public Relations Officer

title: SC assures communication of CJI’s action on inquiry panel report on Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The information followed a submission of a confidential report by the SC in-house committee probing the discovery of half-burnt currency at Justice Yashwant Varma’s official Delhi residence after a fire in March

title: Terror will be tracked and punished, says J&K L-G
content: L-G Manoj Sinha lauds armed forces’ precision strikes; reviews security, directs relocation of civilians from vulnerable areas

title: Kashmir calm, but fear is palpable among the locals
content: We pray the situation does not spiral out of hand, it’s Kashmir that always pays the cost of a war, let sanity prevail and peace follow, said a local

title: Sambhal court issues notice to Rahul Gandhi for remarks on RSS, BJP
content: On January 15, Mr. Gandhi alleged that the BJP and the RSS had ‘captured every institution of the country,’ adding, ‘We are now fighting the BJP, the RSS, and the Indian state itself.’

title: Operation Sindoor: Loitering munitions used against terror bases developed in Bengaluru
content: Loitering munitions, which are also known as suicide or Kamikaze drones, are developed by a Bengaluru-based private company which has a joint venture with an Israel-based military technology company

title: Pondy Bazaar’s multilevel car park ticks all boxes, yet remains underused
content: Most of the shoppers either pay ₹60 per hour for cars or ₹15 per hour for two-wheelers to park along the Pondy Bazaar stretch for convenience or simply because they are unaware of the MLCP

title: Notorious nine: Why India hit them
content: India executed precision strikes on key terror infrastructure inside Pakistan, targeting Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Muhammed strongholds. The strikes hit training camps and operational headquarters, including Muridke and Bahawalpur, long protected by Pakistan's military-intelligence apparatus. These facilities served as hubs for training, indoctrination, and planning numerous terror attacks against India, including the Pulwama attack, before being neutralized.

title: NFL sparks political firestorm by having Trump announce 2027 draft from White House
content: In a surprising move, the NFL announced that Washington, D.C. will host the 2027 NFL Draft, with former President Donald Trump delivering the news from the Oval Office. Commissioner Goodell thanked Trump for his support. Trump praised Commanders owner Josh Harris and Mayor Muriel Bowser, even commenting on the team's quarterback.

title: Government to brief key leaders at all-party meeting today
content: The government has scheduled an all-party meeting on Thursday to brief key political leaders on Operation Sindoor. Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju announced the meeting, which Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is expected to chair. Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge will attend, with the party hoping Prime Minister Modi will preside over the briefing following the operation.

title: 27 airports shut; over 400 flights cancelled today
content: Following heightened tensions, twenty-seven airports across north, west, and central India were temporarily closed, leading to the cancellation of 430 Indian flights on Thursday. Pakistan also experienced significant flight disruptions, with 147 cancellations. Airspace over Pakistan and western India saw a complete absence of civilian air traffic as airlines rerouted flights, primarily impacting international routes.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink gets LOI for satcom licence
content: Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite communications venture, has received a Letter of Intent from the Indian Department of Telecom for a satcom license. This development coincides with ongoing trade negotiations between India and the US. The approval is expected to foster competition in the telecom sector and benefit Indian internet users, paving the way for new investments and advancements in the telecom ecosystem.

title: India unleashes mayhem on 4 Pak & 5 POK terror hubs of LeT, Jaish, Hizb
content: Following the Pahalgam terror massacre, India executed Operation Sindoor, a calculated retaliation involving precision strikes on nine terror hubs in Pakistan and PoK. The IAF and Army synchronized their efforts, utilizing Rafale, Mirage-2000, Sukhoi-30MKI fighters, and loitering munitions to dismantle terrorist infrastructure. The operation aimed to preempt further cross-border attacks while minimizing collateral damage, as confirmed by government officials.

title: PM Modi's recorded speech hints he locked May 7 for strike
content: PM Modi, known for live addresses, recorded a message for a space exploration conference, coinciding with India's strikes in Pakistan and POK following the Pahalgam killings. The recorded speech, delivered calmly, focused on India's space achievements and its commitment to global collaboration in space exploration, even as the government prepared for potential retaliation.

title: Congress hails strikes against Pakistan, reiterates support to Centre
content: Following retaliatory attacks, Congress has voiced its support for the Indian armed forces' decisive response to terror emanating from Pakistan, reiterating backing for the government's decisions in avenging the Pahalgam killings. The Congress Working Committee convened to display political unity, suspending political programs indefinitely. The party lauded the courage of soldiers involved in 'Operation Sindoor' and pledged complete support to the forces.

title: Post strike, India mounts fresh diplomatic offensive
content: Following Operation Sindoor, NSA Ajit Doval briefed global counterparts, including those from the US, UK, and China, emphasizing India's non-escalatory response and readiness to retaliate if provoked. India highlighted the precision of its strikes, avoiding civilian targets, while urging de-escalation. International reactions varied, with many condemning terrorism and calling for restraint, though some expressed concerns over escalation and urged dialogue between India and Pakistan.

title: Wednesday morning turns back clock in Uri to 1998 as heavy shelling begins
content: Tensions flared in Uri after a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, stirring memories of past escalations and the 2016 surgical strikes. Despite a period of relative peace since 2003, residents prepared for the worst, cleaning bunkers and fearing renewed violence. Overnight precision strikes triggered massive Pakistani shelling, forcing evacuations and disrupting daily life, leaving the community in uncertainty as they sought shelter.

title: After brief hiatus, Chennai to receive Krishna water supply from A.P. in a few days
content: Andhra Pradesh authorities had suspended water supply to the city in view of the repair work that was being carried out on the sluice gate of Kandaleru Poondi canal near Kalahasti

title: Construction of bypass to reduce traffic congestion in Tirupattur town begins
content: The four-lane stretch, to come up on the Tirupattur-Singarapettai High Road, will be an alternative route for long-distance travellers to go to places such as Dharmapuri, Salem, and Tiruvannamalai

title: Operation Sindoor: Pakistan authorises armed forces to take ‘action’ after strike
content: In an emotional address to the nation Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif vowed to “avenge every drop of blood” for dozens of Pakistanis believed to have been killed in the attacks by India

title: One dead, nine injured after aircraft crash in Punjab village
content: Crash site in Bathinda district cordoned off; authorities yet to confirm details of unidentified aircraft

title: Supreme Court asks why permanent mechanism cannot be put in place to conduct CLAT like NEET
content: The apex court pointed to “casual manner” in framing CLAT 2025 questions, issued notice to Education Ministry, and recalled its 2018 judgment flagging persistent organisational flaws in the exam.

title: Election Commission tells Supreme Court it will not erase data from EVMs slotted for verification
content: A Bench of Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna and Dipankar Datta was hearing a plea which had contended that the SOP framed by the poll body was not in tune with the April 2024 judgment of the apex court in the EVM-VVPAT case

title: Operation Sindoor: Govt calls all-party meet; Cabinet lauds military strikes
content: According to sources, the Prime Minister lauded the ‘perfect’ operations carried out by the armed forces; Congress hopes that Mr. Modi will attend the all-party meet after having skipped the earlier meeting in the aftermath of Pahalgam terror attack

title: Will resolve FMG issues at the earliest, says medical council Chairperson
content: Four-member panel, including APMC members and Director of Medical Education, formed to look into the issues of Foreign Medical Graduates, including granting of Permanent Registrations

title: Cabinet allocate more funds to five IITs, new scheme for ITIs
content: Cabinet clears ₹11,828 crore for expanding the IITs; greenlights ₹60,000 crore ITI upgrade scheme to skill 20 lakh youth

title: NIA asks tourists, locals to share info related to Pahalgam terror attack
content: The National Investigation Agency urges public cooperation in probe; appeals for photos, videos, and eyewitness accounts of Pahalgam attack

title: India briefs envoys of 13 Security Council members
content: Briefing of 13 envoys from the UNSC as part of a larger strategy to counter Pakistan at UNSC, 1267 terror listing and FATF

title: South CMs, victims’ families hail ‘Operation Sindoor’ as measured response to Pakistan
content: Chief Ministers, Opposition leaders express solidarity with armed forces; families of April 22 victims call strikes ‘befitting’

title: Political leaders across Uttar Pradesh hail armed forces for Operation Sindoor
content: Cross-party support for Army’s counter-terror strike; CM Adityanath, Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav laud response to Pahalgam attack

title: More firms from Tamil Nadu foray into warehousing space
content: Increasing demand for storage and logistics space is encouraging more businesses to venture into this sector

title: Operation Sindoor: Qatar, Spain and other global powers call for de-escalation
content: Qatari PM and Foreign Affairs Minister Al-Thani calls External Affairs Minister Jaishankar and his Pakistan counterpart; other leaders too hold telephonic conversations

title: Amar Mitra’s memories of war and resistance
content: From the blacked-out streets of 1965 Calcutta to the tense borderlands of 1971, eminent writer Amar Mitra recounts acts of quiet defiance and solidarity as Kolkata revisits echoes of war

title: Official panel’s first round of talks with employees’ unions inconclusive
content: Revenue Secretary assures to take up demands with financial implications with the Chief Minister in a week

title: ASHA workers’ protest draws wide support in Kannur
content: The march, which began in Kasaragod on May 5, 2025, is organised by the Kerala ASHA Health Workers Association to press its long-standing demands for better pay and working conditions

title: ‘We stand united against terror’: Mamata backs Centre after Operation Sindoor
content: West Bengal CM calls for national unity in aftermath of ‘Operation Sindoor’; urges calm, announces precautionary measures in schools

title: ‘Operation Abhyaas’ puts Hyderabad’s emergency response to test
content: The city’s biggest civil defence mock drill got underway to test the preparedness for large scale emergencies

title: Religion status would have benefited all Lingayat sub-castes, says M.B. Patl
content: The movement for religion status was wrongly projected by some as a ploy to divide the community, according to him

title: 21 airports in northern parts of India shut until May 10
content: These airports will remain closed till 5.29 a.m. on May 10; the airports span the Union Territories of Jammu and Kashmir as well as Leh, and States of Punjab, Himachal Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Gujarat

title: MGS remembered by colleagues and students
content: The event organised by the MGS History Foundation saw the participation of several noted personalities, including former Calicut University Vice-Chancellor K.K.N. Kurup, historian M.R. Raghava Warrier, and literary critic M.M. Basheer

title: Mysuru gears up for emergency preparedness
content: The district administration has constituted 12 specialised service teams comprising officials from various departments for effective response in the event of any emergency

title: Godavari riverfront development plan works commence in Rajamahendravaram City
content: The riverfront development plan includes development of 22 parks and infrastructure facilities for the Godavari Pushkarams-2027

title: Operation Sindoor receives backing across party lines in Maharashtra
content: Families of Pahalgam attack victims say precision strikes bring “peace”, as leaders across parties commend military response

title: OKC puts on record-setting clinic in 43-point rout
content: The Thunder set team and league records, including an NBA playoff mark with 87 first-half points, in Wednesday's 149-106 blowout of the Nuggets in Game 2.

title: Knicks 'finding ways to win,' go up 2-0 on Celtics
content: Mikal Bridges scored all of his 14 points in the fourth quarter before making his second straight game-clinching steal, and the New York Knicks overcame a 20-point deficit again to beat the Boston Celtics 91-90 on Wednesday night for a 2-0 lead in the...

title: Curry to miss at least a week as Warriors 'adapt'
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry will miss at least one week of the playoffs after he was diagnosed with a Grade 1 left hamstring strain.

title: Finch asks NBA to review Dubs' 'shots at' Gobert
content: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch said his team submitted clips to the league office that showed what he believes was egregious contact made against center Rudy Gobert in Minnesota's 99-88 Game 1 loss.

title: Stanton: Could rejoin Yankees when first eligible
content: Giancarlo Stanton (elbows) said he could return to the Yankees lineup by the end of the month, when he's first eligible.

title: Cease loses no-hit bid, exits with forearm cramp
content: Moments after losing a no-hit bid in the seventh inning, San Diego Padres pitcher Dylan Cease left his start against the New York Yankees because of a cramp in his right forearm.

title: USWNT star Mallory Swanson expecting first child
content: United States forward Mallory Swanson is expecting her first child with husband Dansby Swanson, shortstop for the Chicago Cubs.

title: 📷Inside Saquon Barkley's night at the Met Gala
content: On fashion's biggest night, ESPN goes behind the scenes with the Super Bowl champion and Philadelphia Eagles star.

title: Are the Orioles blowing their contention window? What we can learn from other stacked young teams
content: The path from the top of the prospect rankings to the World Series isn't always a straight line. Here's what the O's can learn from others who have tried to walk it.

title: We graded both sides of the George Pickens trade: How the Cowboys, Steelers fared in the WR move
content: Pickens is headed to Dallas for draft picks. Did the Cowboys solve their WR2 problem -- and did the Steelers create one? Let's size up the move.

title: Arsenal can't shake nearly-men tag as PSG's collective wins out
content: Paris Saint-Germain will get a second chance to heal their 2020 Champions League final heartbreak, where more soul-searching will occur at Arsenal.

title: NFL draft nuggets for every team's rookie class: Exec reaction, draft room maneuvers, remaining needs
content: With the draft dust having settled, we canvassed the league on the biggest decisions and most surprising picks.

title: Experts debate the draft: Who are the early favorites for Rookie of the Year?
content: We asked 17 experts to weigh in on the draft with their top picks, best classes and Rookie of the Year picks.

title: GM is the new gold rush for college football
content: The general manager position is exploding in college football as more and more NFL personnel get involved.

title: Why Man City are making the right call to let De Bruyne go
content: It might sting Kevin de Bruyne and his fans that his time at Man City is coming to an end this summer, but it's the right call for both club and player.

title: Inter Milan, Barcelona write new chapter in UCL folklore
content: Inter's 7-6 aggregate defeat of Barça will go down as one of the Champions League's best-ever set of games.

title: PSG coach revels in 'league of farmers' final spot
content: Luis Enrique mocked Ligue 1's status as a "farmers league" after Paris Saint-Germain sealed a place in the Champions League final with a 3-1 semifinal aggregate win against Arsenal

title: Police seize Maradona's medical records in raid
content: Police carried out an overnight raid at a Buenos Aires health clinic to seize Diego Maradona's complete medical records following a court order during the trial of seven health care professionals accused of negligence in the former soccer star's death.

title: Maracanã among 8 Brazil stadiums for 2027 WWC
content: FIFA president Gianni Infantino announced on Wednesday the eight host cities for the 2027 FIFA Women's World Cup in Brazil.

title: Ange responds to Wenger: We make people crazy
content: Tottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou has hit back at Arsene Wenger's suggestion that the winner of the Europa League should not automatically qualify for the Champions League.

title: Azteca to reopen in March for 2026 World Cup
content: Mexico City's Mayor Clara Brugada announced on Wednesday that the renowned Azteca Stadium will reopen in March 2026 after renovations to meet FIFA standards for hosting the 2026 World Cup.

title: Garnacho 'happy' at Man Utd despite transfer links
content: Alejandro Garnacho has said he's "happy" at Manchester United despite continued speculation about his future.

title: Ancelotti's Real Madrid limbo explained: Why he could leave, and what comes next
content: As Carlo Ancelotti prepares for what appears to be his final Clásico, how could his last few weeks play out? And what's next for him and Real Madrid?

title: Bellingham ruled last season's Clásicos. Can he save Madrid's title hopes vs. Barça?
content: It's been a challenging season for Jude Bellingham, but the title-deciding Clásico is the perfect stage for him.

title: How Golden State wins without Steph: Playoff Jimmy to the rescue?
content: Steph Curry's hamstring strain is a big blow, but the Warriors' addition of Butler gives them a fighting chance.

title: Grading how every men's ACC basketball team performed in 2024-25
content: How should UNC's campaign be judged? What about the conference's newest members? Our verdicts on all 18 teams.

title: The ultimate guide to your draft
content: André Snellings provides a blueprint to follow for fantasy women's basketball drafts including his ideal selections in each round.

title: Everything to know about Monday's NBA draft lottery, from picks to what we're hearing
content: Draft experts Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo break down the odds, likely picks and best fits for prospects.

title: Betting buzz: Curry injury shifts Warriors-Timberwolves Game 2 line five points
content: As oddsmakers continue to monitor Stephen Curry's hamstring strain, the Warriors' odds to win Game 2 against the Timberwolves have moved dramatically.

title: Which players should Chelsea sign? Plus: All you need to know about Estêvão, Essugo, other arrivals
content: Chelsea have spent over €1.6 billion on transfers in the past few years, mainly on young players, so who should they target next? And who is arriving already?

title: Five players you need to trade for right now
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft takes a look at some players who have started slowly that he expects to turn things around quickly.

title: Stock watch: Shelby Miller for saves?
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped and more.

title: Doohan out, Colapinto in: Instability impedes Alpine ambition
content: Alpine has swapped drivers and lost a team principal this week, instability that will keep it down F1's order.

title: Pink Smoke Signals In Rome Call For Women Priests
content: Excluded from the conclave to elect a new pope Wednesday -- and more broadly from the Church's entire global priesthood -- some Catholic women were determined that their voices will be heard.

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: Pak Continues Unprovoked Firing, Soldier Among 13 Killed
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: The Indian armed forces early Wednesday carried out 24 precision missile strikes on nine terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK), including Muridke and Bahawalpur.

title: Check Anti-National Propaganda, Fake News, Amit Shah Tells Border States
content: Following India's precision missile strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, Union Minister Amit Shah has asked border states to stay alert and prepared to respond to any emergency

title: World Records 2nd Warmest April, Temperature Remains Above Normal Levels
content: April 2025 was 0.07 degree Celsius cooler than April 2024 and 0.07 degree Celsius warmer than the third-warmest April recorded in 2016.

title: Centre's All-Party Meet Today On Operation Sindoor: 10 Points
content: The Centre has called an all-party meeting to brief leaders about Operation Sindoor, launched to strike nine terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir.

title: British MP Priti Patel's Shoutout For India's Operation Sindoor In UK Parliament
content: UK Member of Parliament Priti Patel condemned the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack and called on the British government to strengthen counter-terror cooperation with India.

title: Black Smoke Billows From Sistine Chapel Chimney As Conclave Enters Day Two
content: Anticipation gripped the Catholic world Thursday as the cardinals tasked with choosing a new pope prepared to retreat behind the heavy doors of the Vatican's Sistine Chapel for their second day of voting.

title: Watch: Rajasthan's Golden Jaisalmer Fort Goes Dark During Mock Drill
content: The gleaming golden sandstone walls and buildings of Jaisalmer Fort were covered in darkness as all lights were turned off.

title: Soldier, 12 Civilians Killed In Pak Cross-Border Firing Day After Op Sindoor
content: The unprovoked firing comes a day after India launched the Pahalgam counterstrike 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: Trump's Big Teaser Before US-China Trade Talks In Singapore This Week
content: US President Donald Trump has teased a "very, very big announcement" on Thursday. According to the American commander-in-chief, his upcoming announcement is a "major trade deal" with a "big, highly respected country".

title: "Don't Retaliate": US Congressman Ro Khanna's Stern Warning To Pakistan After Op Sindoor
content: Calling Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir a dictator, US Congressman Ro Khanna has called on Islamabad not to retaliate in the aftermath of India's 'Operation Sindoor' that destroyed multiple terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: After India's Operation Sindoor, Pakistan's Propaganda Machine In Full Swing
content: Pakistan has unleashed a full-blown disinformation offensive in a desperate attempt to shift the focus and control the narrative with a barrage of lies and digital theatrics following India's decisive strike under 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: Google Cuts About 200 Staff In Global Business Unit: Report
content: Google on Tuesday cut about 200 jobs across its global business unit, which is responsible for sales and partnerships, The Information reported on Wednesday, citing a person with knowledge of the situation.

title: Over 30% Girls, 13% Boys In India Sexually Violated Before Age 18: Report
content: Over 30 per cent of girls and 13 per cent of boys in India experienced sexual violence before turning 18 years old in 2023, according to an analysis published in The Lancet journal.

title: North Korea Fires Ballistic Missile Into East Coast: South Korea
content: North Korea has fired an unidentified ballistic missile off its east coast, South Korea's military said on Thursday.

title: Trump Declares May 8 As 'Victory Day' In US. What It Means
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday (local time) officially designated May 8 as Victory Day for World War 2, commemorating the 80th anniversary of America's victory in the Second World War.

title: Amid Heightened India-Pakistan Tensions, A Caution From Taliban
content: Afghanistan's Taliban government warned India and Pakistan on Wednesday that further escalation was not "in the interest of the region" after they exchanged artillery fire along their contested frontier.

title: Air India, Air India Express Offer Free Ticket Rescheduling For Armed Forces
content: Air India and Air India Express have offered free rescheduling of tickets or full refunds on cancellations for armed forces personnel who have bookings with the airlines.

title: Pakistan Resorts To Cross Border Shelling In Jammu And Kashmir's Kupwara
content: Pakistani troops resorted to cross-border shelling along the Line of Control (LoC) in Kupwara district of Jammu and Kashmir for the second consecutive day on Thursday, a day after the Indian armed forces targeted terror infrastructure in Pakistan.
